title: (x) Computer Arts font - (similar to) Metsys {Mike Y}
content:
hi, I've wanted to know the name of the font used on the Computer Arts (see sample). The "C" is very PSYOPS / Reykjavik / Reform, but I've checked and no such luck. Anyone?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051934im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/21072.jpg)
author: adriano

comments.content: It reminds me of [T-26 Metsys](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051934/http:/66.70.183.115/fonts/fontshow/db.cgi?db=default&uid=default&ID=33220&ww=on&view_records=View%2BRecords), but it's been tweaked away from that. The broken t is an obvious characteristic. If Gareth Hague didn't design this one, he has someone looking over his shoulder.

Mike's right. It definitely has some serious Metsys underpinnings. I wonder if it's a non-commercial variation from Gareth and David James. Many of their faces tend to riff off of each other. Take [Sylvia](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051934/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=ALT0000124) and [Aminta](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051934/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=ALT0000127) or [Enabler](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051934/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=ALT0000105) and the upcoming Anomoly (I'll try to find an example of this...) for instance.
